intro: Cacalia revoluta, commonly known as the curlleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often curled at the edges. It produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
